title: NASA seems to be in full “send it” mode for the Artemis I mission
description: Space agency officials seem OK with leaving the rocket out in a tropical storm.

title: Amazon hires unsafe trucking firms twice as often as peers, WSJ finds
description: Since 2015, crashes involving Amazon vehicles have killed more than 75 people.

title: 39-year-old Radio Shack laptop gets new CPU, keeps original screen
description: Hobbyist and IEEE editor Stephen Cass upgrades a broken laptop from 1983.

title: How 3 hours of inaction from Amazon cost cryptocurrency holders $235,000
description: For 2nd time in 4 years, Amazon loses control of its IP space in BGP hijacking.

title: Starlink is getting a lot slower as more people use it, speed tests show
description: Starlink capacity limits hit users—SpaceX says more satellites will make it faster.

title: Report: UK authorities have arrested a teenager linked to GTA VI leak
description: If charges stick, arrest counts as fast turnaround for high-profile data breach.

title: Google will start assimilating Fitbit accounts next year
description: At first it's optional, but Fitbit accounts will be shut down in 2025.

title: So long slowdown: New hack runs SNES Star Fox at up to 60 fps
description: 20 fps original is smoothed out without ruining the original pacing.

title: A history of ARM, part 1: Building the first chip
description: In 1983, Acorn Computers needed a CPU. So 10 people built one.

title: Mercedes’ F1 team cut its freight emissions by 89% with biofuel switch
description: 16 trucks used biofuels to haul between the final three European races this year.

title: Many of the most nutritious foods are also the most sustainable
description: A new approach calculates the sustainability of multi-ingredient foods.

title: Rocket Report: SpaceX fires up seven Raptors; SpinLaunch raises big funding round
description: This is the first time the Rocket Report has used the word "yeeted" in its history.

title: Impressions: Shovel Knight Dig is my new roguelite gaming addiction
description: The modern-retro goodness of Shovel Knight returns with a refreshing take on roguelites.
